Package com.company.utility

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.utility.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds information that every game possesses

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​(Player player1, Player player2, int boardSize, int rounds)
      Initializing game which means: setting the board size to the @param boardSize, creating the board with such dimension, setting (by default) the turn to the player (user) and reloading the board.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean anyMovesLeft​()
      Checks if there are any moves left on the board to play
      int getBoardSize​()
      Returns an integer value that represents the dimension of the board
      Player getPlayer1​()
      Returns the first (user) player
      Player getPlayer2​()
      Returns the opponent (user or computer)
      void printBoard​()
      Prints out the game board's state
      void reloadBoard​()
      Resets the game boards state

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(Player player1,
            Player player2,
            int boardSize,
            int rounds)
        Initializing game which means: setting the board size to the @param boardSize, creating the board with such dimension, setting (by default) the turn to the player (user) and reloading the board. Precondition: Receiving a parameter of type short Postcondition: Created object of type Game with a board of n row n dimension (n = boardSize)
        Parameters:
        player1 - first player to join the game (represents a user)
        player2 - second player to join the game (represents a second user or a computer opponent)
        boardSize - value used to initialize the dimensions of the game board
        rounds - value used to initialize the number of rounds the game should last

    • Method Detail

      • reloadBoard

        public void reloadBoard​()
        Resets the game boards state

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard​()
        Prints out the game board's state

      • anyMovesLeft

        public boolean anyMovesLeft​()
        Checks if there are any moves left on the board to play
        Returns:
        true if there are any moves left, false otherwise

      • getPlayer1

        public Player getPlayer1​()
        Returns the first (user) player
        Returns:
        a clone object of the user player

      • getPlayer2

        public Player getPlayer2​()
        Returns the opponent (user or computer)
        Returns:
        a clone object of the opponent player

      • getBoardSize

        public int getBoardSize​()
        Returns an integer value that represents the dimension of the board
        Returns:
        value that represents the current boards's dimensions
